headline: France awards 971MW of ground-mount solar in latest tender
summary_80w: France has awarded 971MW of ground-mount solar capacity, to 165 projects, in the eighth round of the PPE2 PV tender.

headline: Vikram Solar secures 336MW module order for Khavda Project
summary_80w: Vikram Solar has won a 336MW module supply agreement from L&T Construction for the 2.3GW Khavda solar park in Gujarat.

headline: US energy storage market ‘getting used to policy uncertainty’
summary_80w: The US energy storage industry is becoming better equipped to handle the policy uncertainty which has characterised the year so far, Energy-Storage.news has heard.

headline: California set to cut funding for load-reducing distributed storage programme
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Ryan Hledik, Principal at the Brattle Group, and Lauren Nevitt, Senior Director of Public Policy at Sunrun, on the shaky future of California’s Demand Side Grid Support distributed storage programme.

headline: SMA Solar poised to restart US inverter production
summary_80w: German inverter manufacturer SMA Solar is to restart US manufacturing for the first time in ten years.

headline: Euclid raises US$20 million to develop renewables AI platform
summary_80w: Euclid Power has raised US$20 million Series A round led by Venrock to develop AI-driven platform and services for renewables.

headline: Georgia Power approves five solar PPAs with capacity of 1GW
summary_80w: Georgia Power has certified five new solar power purchase agreements (PPAs) within its borders, for a combined capacity of just over 1GW.

headline: Elmya, Atlantica to develop 4GW of utility-scale projects in the US
summary_80w: Elmya Energy and Atlantica have formed a joint venture to develop 4GW of utility-scale renewable energy projects in the US.

headline: Nextracker looks to shake up solar electrical balance of system tech with first product launch
summary_80w: Analysis: The first new product in Nextracker's eBOS portfolio aims for greater standardisation and speed of installation.

headline: New alert system offers PV operators safeguard against hail damage
summary_80w: Vaisala has launched a new hail alert system aimed at solar operators grappling with an increasingly costly problem for PV installations.

headline: ClearGen and Davis Hill invest US$150 million in US community and commercial solar
summary_80w: ClearGen has entered into a US$150 million partnership with Davis Hill to build 245MW of community and commercial solar projects in the US.

headline: Philippines auction attracts 9.4GW in renewable energy bids
summary_80w: A green energy auction in the Philippines has secured 9.4GW of renewable energy capacity subscriptions, of a target of 10.65GW.

headline: 12GWh PHES and 1.2GWh BESS added to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: A 12GWh pumped hydro project and a 1,200MWh battery energy storage system in New South Wales (NSW) have been submitted to Australia’s Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act.

headline: RE+ 2025: Product launches, showcases and news ahead of the biggest clean energy trade show in the US
summary_80w: With RE+ bringing thousands of energy storage professionals to Las Vegas this week, here are some announcements that have hit the Energy-Storage.news desk.

headline: Sungrow deploys first C&I community batteries to undergo CSIP-AUS testing in South Australia
summary_80w: Chinese solar PV inverter and energy storage provider Sungrow has deployed two C&I community batteries, marking the first in South Australia to undergo Common Smart Inverter Profile for Australia (CSIP-AUS) testing.

headline: Neoen Australia energises Western Downs BESS Stage 2 six weeks ahead of schedule
summary_80w: Neoen Australia has announced the successful energisation of the second stage of its 540MWh Western Downs battery energy storage system (BESS) in Queensland, completing the milestone six weeks ahead of schedule.

headline: US ROUND-UP: ContourGlobal powers its first US solar plant, Arevon closes financing on 430MW PV in Missouri
summary_80w: During a week of major US clean energy developments, ContourGlobal, PSE, Arevon, and Ameren Missouri advanced solar projects across four states in the US.

headline: US policy-driven turbulence ‘changes but doesn’t eliminate the opportunity’ for battery storage
summary_80w: ESN Premium speaks with Chris McKissack, CEO of developer Fullmark Energy, on issues affecting the US market today and the company’s transition from its legacy business model.

headline: Nextracker launches new eBOS trunk connector, NX PowerMerge
summary_80w: US solar tracker manufacturer Nextracker has launched a new electrical balance of systems (eBOS) trunk connector.

headline: Fraunhofer ISE, KAUST advance perovskite tandem cell passivation in ‘crucial step for industrialisation’
summary_80w: Scientists from Germany and Saudi Arabia have discovered that perovskite thin-film cells are compatible with current industry standard silicon solar cells, which they claim is a “crucial step toward the industrialisation of perovskite silicon tandem solar cells”.

headline: Sale of Sunnova assets and business confirmed
summary_80w: Newly formed firm Solaris Assets has acquired the business operations and assets of Texas-based residential solar installer Sunnova.

headline: Array Technologies’ trackers certified as compatible with 2,000V systems
summary_80w: US solar tracker manufacturer Array Technologies has announced that two of its tracking systems are compatible with 2,000V solar systems.

headline: Australia: Queensland utility-scale solar PV plants dominate best-performing list for August
summary_80w: Research firm Rystad Energy has found that Queensland’s utility-scale solar PV power plants have dominated the best-performing assets, in terms of AC capacity factor, rankings for August 2025.

headline: SK On signs 7.2GWh deal to supply US-made LFP batteries to Flatiron Energy Development
summary_80w: South Korean company SK On has entered the US BESS market with LFP batteries, securing a supply contract with Flatiron Energy Development.

headline: VIDEO: Model and maximise C&I battery storage profits with Qcells + Geli
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with Qcells + Geli, on modelling and realising maximum profits from commercial & industrial (C&I) battery storage systems.

headline: SOC errors in LFP batteries are draining revenue – here’s how to fix it
summary_80w: Last summer, a Texas energy storage operator watched in frustration as their battery system missed a golden trading opportunity during a peak demand window.

headline: Fluence deploys first full product ecosystem at Tilt Renewables’ 200MWh BESS in Victoria, Australia
summary_80w: Australian renewable energy company Tilt Renewables has officially inaugurated its 100MW/200MWh Latrobe Valley battery energy storage system (BESS) near Morwell, Victoria.

headline: Biden tariff moratorium ‘single worst policy’ for US solar supply chain
summary_80w: Analysis: A Biden-era policy to suspend the payment of duties on Southeast Asian module imports looks set to backfire badly on an already under-pressure US solar industry.

headline: Argentina awards 667MW in first energy storage tender
summary_80w: Argentina has awarded 667MW of battery energy storage system (BESS) in its first tender under the AlmaGBA scheme.

headline: India cuts GST on renewable energy components from 12% to 5%
summary_80w: India’s Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, the joint forum of the Centre and States, has reduced the GST rate on renewable energy components from 12% to 5%.

headline: Fraunhofer ISE completes testing on grid-forming inverters, to publish results next month
summary_80w: Fraunhofer ISE has completed testing work of grid-forming inverters currently available in the energy industry.

headline: Governor Newsom signs executive order to accelerate projects at risk of losing IRA support
summary_80w: Gavin Newsom has signed an executive order to accelerate the permitting of energy generation projects that could be set to lose IRA support.

headline: Czech Republic warns of cybersecurity threat from Chinese solar inverters
summary_80w: The Czech national cybersecurity agency has warned that Chinese solar inverters represent a threat to the country’s data security.

headline: Highland Materials to begin polysilicon plant construction in H2 2026
summary_80w: US polysilicon company Highland Materials has aimed to begin construction at its polysilicon plant in the second half of 2026.

headline: Waaree Energies acquires 64% stake in transformer maker Kotsons
summary_80w: Indian solar manufacturer Waaree Energies has acquired a 64% equity stake in power transformer manufacturing company Kotsons.

headline: ‘Innovation allows us to compete straight up against China on polysilicon’
summary_80w: PV Talk: Highland Materials' CEO Richard Rast explains how the company aims to compete in the polysilicon landscape through US innovation.

headline: FTC Solar launches automated 80 degree hail stow angle for 1P Pioneer tracker
summary_80w: US tracker manufacturer FTC Solar has launched an automated 80 degree hail stow angle for its flagship 1P Pioneer tracker.

headline: ARENA launches AU$150 million second round of Solar Sunshot programme in Australia
summary_80w: ARENA has launched the second funding round of its AU$1 billion Solar Sunshot programme, making AU$150 million available.

headline: Washington governor delays approval of hybrid BESS proposal from Cypress Creek Renewables
summary_80w: The Governor of Washington State has delayed issuing final approval of a hybrid BESS facility under development by Cypress Creek Renewables.

headline: Swift Current Energy closes US$242 million financing for Virginia battery storage project
summary_80w: Swift Current Energy has secured US$242 million for what the developer claimed will be the biggest BESS project in the PJM service area.

headline: Texas: Ormat brings online 120MWh BESS, Engie partners with data centre developer
summary_80w: In a double-hit of Texas news, Ormat is commencing operations at its Lower Rio facility, Engie is partnering with Prometheus Hyperscale to power data centres.

headline: South African government’s 11GWh BESS procurement in charts
summary_80w: The government of South Africa has secured nearly 1.7GW/11GWh of grid-scale BESS capacity via various procurement programmes, though questions remain around their integrity and deliverability.

headline: Australia’s CEFC commits record AU$3.8 billion to Victoria-Tasmania Marinus Link interconnector
summary_80w: Australia's Clean Energy Finance Corporation (CEFC) has announced its largest-ever investment commitment, with AU$3.8 billion (US$2.5 billion) allocated to support the Marinus Link interconnector connecting the states of Tasmania and Victoria.

headline: Akaysha Energy bags AU$300 million corporate debt facility for global battery storage expansion
summary_80w: Australian battery storage developer Akaysha Energy has secured an AU$300 million (US$196 million) corporate debt facility to accelerate its growing portfolio of utility-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) projects across Australia and global markets.

headline: UK BESS operators complete 427MW of grid-scale capacity in August
summary_80w: The UK had one of its best months of the year for large-scale BESS projects being completed in August.

headline: Alight and Neoen power up 100MW PV plant in Sweden
summary_80w: Developers Alight Neoen have commissioned the 100MWp Hultsfred Solar Farm in Småland, southern Sweden.

headline: US residential PV prices remain stable but industry confidence falters – EnergySage
summary_80w: US residential solar prices have remained at historic lows in the first half of the year despite market uncertainty and continued high interest rates.

headline: Trinasolar, Holosolis ink TOPCon patent licence agreement in Europe
summary_80w: Chinese solar manufacturer Trinasolar has signed a patent licence agreement with French module manufacturing startup Holosolis to use its TOPCon solar cell technology.

headline: India adds 2.8GW rooftop solar in H1 2025, up 158% year-on-year
summary_80w: India has added 2.8GW of rooftop solar in H1 2025, a 158% year-on-year surge from just 1.1GW in the same period last year.

headline: Huasun claims 34.02% efficiency on HJT-perovskite tandem cell
summary_80w: Huasun claims it has set new record efficiencies for HJT-perovskite tandem solar cells at both laboratory and commercial scales.

headline: Peak Energy breaks ground on 65MWp solar project in Philippines
summary_80w: Singapore-headquartered independent power producer Peak Energy has broken ground on a 65MWp solar project in Isabela, in the Cagayan Valley region of northeast Luzon, Philippines.

headline: China’s top four solar manufacturers suffer US$1.54 billion in losses in H1 2025
summary_80w: LONGi, Jinko Solar, Trina Solar and JA Solar posted combined net losses of nearly RMB11 billion (US$1.54 billion) in H1 2025.

headline: Michigan utilities’ US$800 million case over ‘defective’ pumped hydro upgrade goes to trial
summary_80w: Consumers Energy and DTE Energy’s case against contractor TAES over work on a pumped hydro energy storage plant will go to court.

headline: Fire at Arevon Energy’s California solar-plus-storage facility
summary_80w: During the morning of 30 August 2025, the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection (CAL FIRE) responded to a possible vegetation fire in the area of independent power producer (IPP) Arevon Energy’s California Flats solar-plus-storage project.

headline: Tips from an EPC to navigate complex BESS codes, constructability and safety, Pt. 2
summary_80w: Andrew Early and Ben Echeverria of EPC Burns & McDonnell continue their list of tips for navigating the choppy waters of battery storage project delivery.

headline: Chile: Big renewables-plus-storage project progress from Grenergy, AES and Verano
summary_80w: Chile is leading Latin America’s wave of energy storage adoption, closely linked to its embrace of solar PV.

headline: 910MWh of BESS from Quinbrook, Akaysha Energy nears commissioning in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: 910MWh of BESS in Queensland, Australia, has been added to AEMO’s Market Management System, signalling readiness for commissioning.

headline: GES to build 695MW AES Andes co-located renewables project in Chile
summary_80w: Spanish construction firm GES (Global Energy Services) has secured a contract to build a roughly 700MW solar-wind-storage hybrid project in Chile.

headline: Ingeteam provides PV inverters for 640MW solar plant in Texas
summary_80w: Ingeteam has supplied its INGECON SUN 3Power Series C liquid-cooled central PV inverters for a 640MW solar PV plant in Texas.

headline: Iberdrola commissions 316MW Spanish solar PV project
summary_80w: Iberdrola has commissioned the 316MW Ciudad Rodrigo solar project in Salamanca, Spain, the company’s second solar plant in the province.

headline: Q Energy secures financing for 252MW PV portfolio in Spain
summary_80w: Q Energy has reached financial close for Taurus B, a portfolio of seven solar PV plants in Spain with a combined capacity of 251.71MWp.

headline: Fraunhofer ISE to build pilot TOPCon cell line to support 4GW Talon PV US facility
summary_80w: The Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy Systems (ISE) will build a pilot solar cell line in Germany to support US manufacturer Talon PV’s efforts to establish solar cell capacity in the US.

headline: SMA Solar predicts losses and ‘restructuring’ amid residential market decline
summary_80w: SMA Solar has forecast financial losses and further restructuring measures in 2025, as it responds to falling sales and a “challenging” market for residential and commercial renewable energy installations.

headline: OX2 appoints former BayWa r.e. head as new CEO
summary_80w: Swedish independent power producer (IPP) OX2 has appointed Matthias Taft as its new chief executive officer.

headline: Scatec signs 15-year PPA for 130MW solar project in Colombia
summary_80w: Scatec has signed a 15-year power purchase agreement (PPA) with BTG Pactual Comercializadora de Energia to develop a 130MW solar project in Colombia.

headline: Grenergy sells phase four of Oasis de Atacama solar-plus-storage project
summary_80w: Spanish independent power producer (IPP) Grenergy has sold the fourth phase of its flagship solar-plus-storage project in Chile, Oasis de Atacama.

headline: NEM data spotlight: Solar PV generation strikes back with record-breaking month
summary_80w: In August 2025, the final month of Australia’s winter, utility-scale and rooftop solar PV generation in the National Electricity Market (NEM) saw a dramatic 22.5% month-on-month increase to 3,338GWh.

headline: How PAE Engineers is incorporating microgrids into sustainable building designs
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news speaks with Karina Hershberg, Associate Principal at engineering firm PAE Engineers, on integrating microgrids with sustainable building design.

headline: Maryland county officials deny rezoning request for East Point Energy’s 600MWh BESS project
summary_80w: East Point Energy has been dealt a blow in its pursuit to construct a 150MW/600MWh BESS in Maryland.

headline: BESS codes, constructability and safety require technical, regulatory insight: 10 tips from an EPC
summary_80w: Andrew Early and Ben Echeverria of EPC Burns & McDonnell offer their strategies for navigating the complexities of large-scale battery storage.

headline: HEIT sale ‘proved us right’ about private capital and BESS, Harmony says
summary_80w: The sale of the UK BESS-holding Harmony Energy Income Trust (HEIT) proved private capital's greater patience and valuation around the asset class, the CEO of its former investment advisor told Energy-Storage.news.

headline: Vertically integrated cell-BESS suppliers lose market share as competition increases
summary_80w: The market share of vertically integrated battery cell and BESS companies has fallen since 2023, market intelligence firm Rho Motion said.

headline: Grid-forming battery storage: ‘Standby consumption will be higher’ says Australia’s AGL
summary_80w: “The speed at which the grid-forming inverters are operating means that standby consumption will be higher,” said Dave Bowly of AGL.

headline: Securing the future of energy storage: Navigating the cybersecurity landscape
summary_80w: Katherine Hutton, product manager of cybersecurity at Fluence, discusses why cybersecurity is critical for battery storage systems and how to navigate this increasingly complex area.

headline: Sembcorp to build 86MWp floating solar project on Singapore’s Pandan Reservoir
summary_80w: Sembcorp Solar Singapore has won a tender to develop an 86MWp floating solar PV project on Pandan Reservoir.

headline: A year in review: solar moves centre stage in UK’s decarbonisation goals
summary_80w: The UK’s new Labour government took power last summer, promising a renewable energy revolution, with solar playing a lead role.

headline: CALSSA calls for US$10 million fine for utilities for slow residential solar and storage approval
summary_80w: California's solar and storage association has called for US$10 million fines for PG&E and SCE for failing to approve residential solar and storage projects applications quickly.

headline: Syria signs deal with STE to build 100MW solar PV plant
summary_80w: General Corporation for Electricity Transmission and Distribution has signed a deal with Syrian-Turkish Energy Company (STE) to build a 100MW solar plant in Kafr Behm, Hama Governorate.

headline: Solar Organic to build 10GW solar, battery manufacturing site in Spain
summary_80w: Solar Organic Centro España is planning to build a 10GW solar module and battery manufacturing facility in the Spanish autonomous community of Castilla-La Mancha.

headline: US ITC to pursue investigation on PV cell imports from India, Indonesia and Laos
summary_80w: The US International Trade Commission (ITC) has voted to continue the investigation on imported solar cells from India, Indonesia and Laos.

headline: Utility-scale solar and wind hit a record 47.2% electricity share in Australia’s NEM
summary_80w: Australia’s National Electricity Market (NEM) hit a record high for the combined utility-scale solar PV and wind share in the electricity mix on 30 August.

headline: Chinese battery manufacturer Hithium ships first units from Texas BESS assembly plant
summary_80w: Hithium has shipped the first battery energy storage systems (BESS) manufactured at its new plant in Texas, US.

headline: Multinational consortium agrees to invest US$220 million in solar PV, BESS factory in Egypt
summary_80w: Bahraini, Chinese, Egyptian and Emirati groups have agreed to develop a new manufacturing facility in Egypt.

headline: India’s Sunsure signs 500MWh fixed tariff BESS contract to supply Uttar Pradesh during peaks
summary_80w: Renewable energy solutions provider Sunsure Energy claims to have signed India’s first-ever fixed tariff battery storage offtake contract.

headline: Neoen switches on 2.2GWh BESS in Western Australia
summary_80w: French independent power producer (IPP) Neoen, which is now fully owned by Canadian investment firm Brookfield, has switched on the second phase of its 560MW/2,240MWh Collie BESS in Western Australia.

headline: Hitachi Energy acquires Powin’s remaining stake in power conversion system maker Eks Energy
summary_80w: Hitachi Energy has been successful in its bid to acquire full ownership of Eks Energy, a manufacturer of power conversion systems (PCS).

headline: Capacity Investment Scheme Tenders open, targeting 2.4GWh of energy storage in Western Australia
summary_80w: The Australian government has opened two CIS tenders in Western Australia, targeting 2.4GWh of energy storage and 1.6GW of renewables.

headline: Potentia’s 900MWh BESS site the first to be approved under South Australia’s HRE Act
summary_80w: Potentia Energy, a joint venture co-owned by Enel Green Power and INPEX, has secured the first environmental approval for a grid-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) under South Australia's new Hydrogen and Renewable Energy (HRE) Act.

headline: CAISO monitoring for ‘detrimental market behaviour’ in BESS Bid Cost Recovery process
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Sergio Melendez, storage sector manager at CAISO, and Ali Karimian, market optimisation director at GridBeyond, about regulating Bid Cost Recovery Payments in the California Independent System Operator market.

headline: PG&E delays recommissioning of California BESS adjacent to fire-hit Moss Landing project to next year
summary_80w: California utility Pacific Gas and Electric (PG&E) has pushed back recommissioning of the Elkhorn battery energy storage system (BESS) by approximately one year, to 30 June 2026.

headline: California and Texas ‘remain the most stable profiles’ for battery storage asset owners
summary_80w: California and Texas have been “really good proving grounds” for energy storage, according to the CEO of developer Fullmark Energy.

headline: MEAG and SMA Altenso partner on 354MWh Germany BESS with ‘next-gen’ inverters
summary_80w: Asset manager MEAG and a subsidiary of inverter specialist SMA have partnered to deploy a 130MW/354MWh BESS in Germany, their second together and one which will deploy 'next-generation' inverters.

headline: EC-funded study progresses battery storage hybridisation of pumped hydro plant in Slovakia
summary_80w: European Commission funding is supporting a project to integrate battery storage at a pumped hydro energy storage (PHES) plant in Slovakia.

headline: Wood Mackenzie: ‘Australia is a leading country for grid-forming BESS’
summary_80w: “Australia is one of the leading countries for grid-forming inverters,” said Natalie Thompson, senior analyst of energy storage and solar at Wood Mackenzie, when discussing the Australian energy storage market.

headline: TagEnergy acquires ACE Power, adding 6GW of energy storage and renewables in Australia
summary_80w: Renewables developer and independent power producer (IPP) TagEnergy has acquired Australian developer ACE Power, adding 6GW of energy storage and renewables projects to its portfolio.

headline: Pacifico, Zenith Volts and Fermi America propose gigawatt-scale energy solutions with BESS to feed US data centres
summary_80w: Three companies, Pacifico Energy, Zenith Volts, and Fermi America have begun expanding power generation and energy storage capabilities for US data centre development.

headline: Harmony Energy CEO on lessons learned from HEIT, strategy going forward and European expansion
summary_80w: We catch up with the CEO of BESS developer Harmony Energy about its strategy and plans going forward, following the sale of its affiliated Harmony Energy Income Trust (HEIT).

headline: California’s Orange County is latest jurisdiction to introduce new BESS zoning standards
summary_80w: Following in the footsteps of several other US jurisdictions this year, officials at California’s Orange County are one step closer to amending zoning laws to allow the development of BESS.

headline: Lithuania’s capex support scheme to help fund 4,000MWh of energy storage
summary_80w: An EU-backed energy storage capex support scheme in Lithuania will support as much as 4,000MWh of battery storage, the Ministry of Energy has said.

headline: Sungrow plans Hong Kong listing; ESS revenues overtake PV inverters
summary_80w: Chinese solar PV inverter and energy storage provider Sungrow has announced two major developments: plans for a Hong Kong IPO and the release of its half-year 2025 interim report.
